qas.question: In what year was the constitution of Swaziland suspended?
Who ruled Swaziland in the late 1970s?
When did King Sobhuza II die?
Who was the head of state of Swaziland after King Sobhuza II
Which monarch of Swaziland was crownd in April 1986?
who suspended Swazilands constitution in the 19th century?
When was the son ofDzeliwe Shongwe crowned king?
Who ruled Swaziland starting in 1973 and ending 1982?
What rerent ruled for 61 years in Swaziland?

context: Following the elections of <a0_0>1973<a0_0/>, the constitution of Swaziland was suspended by <a1_0><b5_0><b7_0>King Sobhuza II<b7_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> who thereafter ruled the country by decree until his death in <a2_0>1982<a2_0/>. At this point Sobhuza II had ruled Swaziland for 61 years, making him the longest ruling monarch in history. A regency followed his death, with <a3_0><b8_0>Queen Regent Dzeliwe Shongwe<b8_0/><a3_0/> being head of state until 1984 when she was removed by Liqoqo and replaced by Queen Mother Ntfombi Tfwala. <a4_0>Mswati III<a4_0/>, the son of Ntfombi, was crowned king on <b6_0>25 April 1986<b6_0/> as King and Ingwenyama of Swaziland.
